=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/04/13 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Greg Weisman', 'Brandon Vietti'], 'Starring': ['Jesse McCartney', 'Nolan North', 'Stephanie Lemelin']} Review Text: I'm a big DC fan. This series has got to be THE WORST DC series I've ever watched.

Edit: Having finished it now, the later episodes were slightly better, but not enough to give it 2 stars. Maybe it's because I'm not a teen and this seemed super aimed at early teenagers. Review Title: D U L L!! REALY wish I hadn't bought it. Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

Mr. Holmes [DVD + Digital] Ian McKellen (Actor), Laura Linney (Actor), Bill Condon (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama ["Mr. Holmes is a new twist on the world’s most famous detective. In 1947, in his remote seaside farmhouse, an aging Sherlock Holmes (Ian McKellen, Academy Award (r) nominee, 2002, Best Actor in a Supporting Role, The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring) tends to his bees, with only the company of his housekeeper (Laura Linney, Academy Award (r) nominee, 2001, Best Actress in a Leading Role, You Can Count on Me) and her charming young son, Roger. Grappling with the diminishing powers of his mind, Holmes comes to rely upon the boy as he revisits the circumstances of the unsolved case that forced him into retirement, and searches for answers to the mysteries of life and love – before it's too late."] {'Genre': 'Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Laura Linney, Bill Condon, Hiroyuki Sanada, Milo Parker, Jeffrey Hatcher, Ian McKellen, Mitch Cullin', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '35225428', 'Director': 'Bill Condon', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 10, 2015', 'Actors': 'Ian McKellen, Laura Linney, Milo Parker, Hiroyuki Sanada', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Mitch Cullin, Jeffrey Hatcher', 'Number of discs': '1'} The DVD makes is incredibly hard to start the movie, and once there, if you stop or turn of the movie for any reason, you can start it back up, either then or later, you have to go through all the 4 minutes of the DVD's "starting" garbage.

I stopped half way into it last night, had to restart, wasted half an hour with scene selection (having to go through the 4 minutes of "startup" in between each selection), the when I finally found the place, accidentally pressed stop instead of play, which reset the DVD for the 10th time. So I clicked eject. So I can't say how good the movie is but this DVD is horribly made.

My DVD player is perfectly capable of remembering where it left off other DVDs, even weeks later. The studio spent tons of money on the movie then apparently gave the DVD & its menus to be made by their unemployed nephew for $20. So I can't say how good the movie is but this DVD is HORRIBLY made. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest**: The user remains engaged with science fiction television and films, particularly those blending fantasy elements with complex narratives, while showing a strong preference for adaptations that delve into philosophical themes.

- **Content Preferences**: The recent purchase experience has highlighted a growing frustration with content that fails to meet their expectations, reflected in a notably low rating for a series aimed at younger audiences. Despite their loyalty to specific genres like DC, they are critical of execution and target demographic alignment.

- **Format Preference**: They favor well-crafted DVD collections for their tangible quality, but frustrations with poor packaging emphasize their demand for usability and attention to detail.

- **Quality Appreciation**: The user maintains a strong awareness of production quality and storytelling depth. Their ability to reassess expectations is evident; however, they are less forgiving regarding content that feels immature or overly simplistic.

- **Engagement with Series and Films**: While they occasionally purchase new content, their latest critique suggests a reassessment of exploration into other segments, leaning towards quality over brand loyalty.

- **Rating Behavior**: The user's ratings now reflect more pronounced disappointment when standards fall short, as evidenced by the significant downgrade in rating for a series they initially hoped to enjoy. Their focus on narrative and overall execution remains steadfast, with a heightened sensitivity to age targeting and thematic depth.
